title: How To Introduce A New Hen To The Hen House

tasks.task: Introduce a new hen to the hen house
subtasks: Place new hen in a wire dog crate
Position the crate within the chicken run
Allow chickens to observe new hen without physical contact
Wait for three days until chickens lose interest
Open crate to let new hen exit when ready
Alternative method of introducing by placing in hen house during darkness

tasks.task: Introduce a rooster (Mr. Brown) to existing hens
subtasks: Allow rooster access to fenced area for gradual acquainting
Place rooster in dog crate for safety during full integration
Calculate daily water requirement (half body weight in ounces)
Ensure adequate water consumption (e.g., eight ounces remaining)

tasks.task: Introduce a new hen to the hen house
subtasks: Place new hen in a wire dog crate
Position the crate within the chicken run to allow observation
Allow chickens to observe the new hen, noting their initial interaction and subsequent loss of interest
Wait approximately three days before checking if the chickens have lost interest in the new hen
Open the crate door when the chickens have shown no interest to allow the new hen to exit when ready
Consider placing the new hen in the hen house during darkness to reduce the likelihood of immediate confrontation

tasks.task: Introduce a rooster (Mr. Brown) to existing hens
subtasks: Allow Mr. Brown access to a fenced area of the chicken run for gradual acquaintance
Use a wire dog crate when integrating Mr. Brown fully into the chicken run for safety
Calculate daily water requirement based on half the body weight in ounces (e.g., 150 pounds requires 75 ounces)
Ensure adequate water consumption, noting remaining amounts (e.g., 8 ounces left)before bed
